summary: An email from Jeff Cranor, a customer support technician at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions, inquiring about a copy of an order specifying the model and type of hard drives sent by someone named Justin. The email suggests the drives may be intended for use in a RAID configuration and is related to technical support.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: Author of the email, working for SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions, seeking information about a hard drive order.

persons.name: Justin
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who sent an order containing hard drive specifications; recipient is asked to provide a copy of that order.

connections.description: Jeff is seeking a copy of a hard drive order that Justin previously sent to an unspecified recipient, indicating a work-related communication chain.

events.title: Email Inquiry About Hard Drive Order
events.description: Jeff Cranor sends an email asking if the recipient has a copy of an order from Justin detailing the model and type of hard drives, as he believes he found a compatible type for a RAID.

locations: 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The email is dated August 11, 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
The correspondence involves technical discussion about hard drives and a RAID configuration, potentially related to data storage or recovery.
The sender, Jeff Cranor, works for SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions, which provides federal solutions, possibly indicating government or secure contracting work.
The email footer contains a standard confidentiality notice, treating the content as potentially proprietary or legally protected.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting the hard drives in question may be relevant to the investigation or evidence handling.
